column4: heh.. figured it was flash (mainly youtube) that was causing my system lockups
youtube can go suck a pigstick
nau i use flashvideoreplacer fwd to wmp codec
If you have flash running in 11.04, I'm curious as to what browser are you using? I can't make flash work with Firefox 4.01.
firefox 4.01
Hm... Just won't work for me. Only way to see flash (if I need to) is using Opera.
Shockwave Flash 10.3 r181
Did you install from the adobe website or using one of the pacakges in Synaptic?
lemmie check
ok.
10.3.181.22ubuntu0.11.04.1 (flashplugin-installer)  (through software center)

although with firefox, you /can/ do what i ended up doing and install flashvideoreplacer (add-on) and then run through the settings till you find one that works.. (flash causes massive system lock ups on youtube)
I don't use youtube very much.
ok. I'll try again with flashplugin-installer. I'll shutdown FF, remove package, the re-install and see if that helps.
Nope. I go to youtube as a quick test and it always tells me I need to upgrade to flash player 10.
When it locks up can you still Ctrl-Alt-F1 to get to a console window?
Are your video card drivers up to date?
yep.. using latest from nvidia
What desktop thing are you using Unity or gnome?
I was going to suggest whether its something to do with Compiz. You can also start up with ubuntu-classic (no effects) and see if that makes a change.
If its happening in Windows too that sounds like something other than an OS problem. Possibly a hardware related issue.
Could it be a heat related thing? Does the problem only happen when the machine has been running a while or can you make it lock up just after turning on the machine?
it's not heat related, as i can run minecraft and get my temps up to 105 gpu and 85 cpu   without any errors
Not so much the mother board but the whole package.
